chapter.title: Genral Elements and Other Elements not Discussed Elsewhere

section.title: Overview
section.para: Since Docbook was defined to describe a wide range of publishable content, it includes a number of elements that are used to perform common tasks. These elements include ones that specify superscripts and emphasis.

It also includes a number of elements that you are unlikely to need when documenting CeltiXfire. Among these elements are a large set used to define GUI elements. These elements are legal in the CeltiXfire documentation. However, they are not used enough to mertit a full discussion.

section.title: Formating Elements
section.para: The following are common formating elements used in Docbook:

seglistitem.seg: Specifies that the content of the element is to be empasized by either itallics or boldface. The default is to use itallics. You specify boldface by setting the role attribute to strong.
